section.name: LoggerAppenderMail
section.p: LoggerAppenderMail appends log events via email.

This appender does not send individual emails for each logging requests but will collect them in a buffer and send them all in a single email once the appender is closed (i.e. when the script exists). Because of this, it may not appropriate for long running scripts, in which case LoggerAppenderMailEvent might be a better choice.
Note: When working in Windows, make sure that the SMTP and smpt_port values in php.ini are set to the correct values for your email server (address and port).

subsection.name: Layout
subsection.p: This appender requires a layout. If no layout is specified in configuration, LoggerLayoutSimple will be used by default.

tr.td: Email address(es) to which the log will be sent. Multiple email addresses may be specified by separating them with a comma.
Email address which will be used in the From field.

subsection.name: Examples
subsection.p: This example shows how to configure LoggerAppenderMail to send the log to two email addresses.

div.pre: <configuration xmlns="http://logging.apache.org/log4php/"> <appender name="default" class="LoggerAppenderMail"> <layout class="LoggerLayoutSimple" /> <param name="to" value="foo@example.com,baz@example.com" /> <param name="from" value="logger@example.com" /> </appender> <root> <appender_ref ref="default" /> </root> </configuration>
